engine._hint_wide_root_noise:
A higher value here (typically 0.05-0.1)
makes the analysis explore more moves
at the cost of some strength.

Default._help_right: No settings available for Default KataGo AI, strength is mainly affected by `max_visits` and `model` in the main settings `engine` section.

Balance._help_left: Will try to win by `target_score`, lose at most `random_loss` when behind and `max_loss` when ahead.
Balance._help_right: Never plays moves with less than `min_visits` visits, so also check engine settings.

Jigo._help_left: Will try to win by `target_score`, without further restrictions.
Jigo._help_right: Also affected by engine settings such as `max_visits`.

ScoreLoss._help_left: Plays moves weighted inversely by point loss.
ScoreLoss._help_right: Also affected by engine settings such as `max_visits`, likely to play more varied/weaker with higher visits.

Policy._help_left: Strength is mainly affected by `model` in engine settings, but should be high dan regardless.
Policy._help_right: Plays the P:Weighted strategy during the first `opening_moves` * <number of intersections> moves to allow variety.

P:Weighted._help_right: pick_override` determines when top move is chosen without randomness, and `lower_bound` determines the lower bound policy value that is allowed.
P:Weighted._help_left: Plays move with probability=policy^(1/weaken_fac),i.e. `weaken_fac` influences how much more likely weaker moves are picked.

P:Pick._help_left: Picks `pick_n + pick_frac * <number of legal moves>` at random and plays the best one. Change `pick_frac` to make it see more moves.
P:Pick._help_right: Plays top move if policy value is above `pick_override` to avoid obvious mistakes.

P:Local._help_left: Samples `pick_n + pick_frac * <number of legal moves>` near the last move and plays the best one.
P:Local._help_right: Lower `stddev` makes it prefer closer moves.

P:Tenuki._help_left: Samples `pick_n + pick_frac * <number of legal moves>` away from the last move and plays the best one.
P:Tenuki._help_right: Increase `stddev` makes it prefer moves further away. Stops tenukiing after the 'endgame' fraction of the board is filled.

P:Influence._help_left: Samples `pick_n + pick_frac * <number of legal moves>` and plays the best one, biased to above the `threshold` line.
P:Influence._help_right: Increase `line_weight` to penalize moves near the edge more. Stops strategy after the 'endgame' fraction of the board is filled.

P:Territory._help_left: Samples `pick_n + pick_frac * <number of legal moves>` and plays the best one, biased to below the `threshold` line.
P:Territory._help_right: Increase `line_weight` to penalize moves closer to the center more.  Stops strategy after the 'endgame' fraction of the board is filled.

debug._hint_level:
0: Little console output.
1: Some extra output
for error reporting.
